args: Say! Never thought I'd run into you\nin these parts!
...What am I doin' here? Oh, just waitin'\nfor Sha Wujing and Xuan Zang.
How's that? You wanna know how I came\nto be traveling with them to begin with?\nHa! Now THERE'S a story!
Well, I've got some time before I have\nto meet up with 'em. Let's grab some\ngrub and I'll tell you all about it.
...Yo! Two steamed buns here!\nSo the story starts 10 years ago,\nback when I was still in Taiwu.
Harvest was real bad that year, which meant\nmerchants were hoarding what little food there\nwas in order to turn a quick buck.

It's always a bad time to be poor, but that was a
REAL bad time. And when the folks in charge didn't
do squat, my hometown rose up in rebellion.
Next thing you know, the army's at our door.
General! The army is deploying\ntheir new weapons against us!
Damn that Sha Wujing and his toys...\nI'm gonna send him home in a box!

I was once part of the emperor's army,
but chose to join the rebels. We were holding
our own at first, but when the tide went,
it went out quick.
The fight is lost, General. Our only options\nnow are escape or surrender.
Belay that talk, solider! We ain't done yet.

Heed me, my suffering countrymen!
His Imperial Majesty has taken this matter
to heart, and has proclaimed you shall
receive the support you need!
If you lay down your weapons, you may\nreturn to your homes as free men!
They've agreed to help!\nWe did it! We did it!
Stow your celebration! The fight ain't\nover just because they agreed to our\noriginal request!
But now that we have food,\nthere's no reason to fight.

Bah! You need to dream bigger, friend!
If we win this, we can demand a hundred
years of tax exemption! When a real man
starts a fight, he sees it THROUGH.
Any who do not lay down their arms now\nwill be punished as traitors along with\ntheir families! Make your choice!
We didn't start this for glory or a hundred\nyears of anything; we started this so our\nfamilies wouldn't starve to death.

Guess the powers that be liked my mettle, because
despite joining the rebellion, I was allowed to stay
in the army—though they busted me down in rank
and sent me to patrol some lonely border.
I was made to marry the daughter of a low-ranking\nnoble. Maybe they thought married life would\nsettle me down.
(We've had a nice, long peace since\nthe day we ended our rebellion.)
We've returned from our patrol, sir!\nNothing unusual to report!
Course there ain't. There never is.\nYou guys really need to stop taking\nthis make-work job so seriously.
But sir, our patrols help to make everyone\nwho lives in this area feel at ease...
N-no, sir! Nothing important, sir!\nOh, and we saw your wife on our patrol—\nshe asked us to bring you lunch.
I ain't hungry. Just set it down there\nand go find some grub for yourselves.
Not like she wanted to make me\nlunch in the first place...
Tsk! It appears someone oozed out of\nthe wrong side of the bed this morning.
Well, look who's here. What brings a big-\nboots tactician like you to a nowhere\nspeck on the map like this?
I just wanted to see my old friend's face—\nthough I imagine you are less excited to\nsee a traitor such as me, hmmmMMM?
Do what you want—I ain't one\nfor dwelling on the past.
Then why the long face? Please tell me\nyou're not still upset about how your\nrebellion ended.
Yes, you lost, but the people's grievances\nwere heard, and no one starved. Was that\nnot the point of everything in the end?
I didn't join the rebellion to help people.
I thought that if we won that battle,\nI'd be able to achieve something BIG.
You always were the largest of dreamers.\nWell, I might have something for you:\nHave you perchance heard of Qilin relics?
Those magic tools from faerie tales?\nGet outta here with that nonsense.

They exist, old friend—or at least our
leaders believe they do. That is why they
established a top-secret organization to
sniff out every last one of them.

I never kid. In fact, after asking me to
join the organization, they took me to
a secret vault and showed me all the
info they'd collected on Qilin relics.

The Hong Hulu sucks people inside it!
The Yong Run Hu creates endless torrents!
Ah, but one relic tickled my fancy with
endless delight above all others...

The Jiu Chi Dingba—a terrifying object
that summons howling winds across vast
distances, and creates flames that burn
to ash all things in their wake!
Sounds like the kind of thing that could\nturn the tide of most any battle.
Isn't it FASCINATING? Sadly for the\norganization, all of their efforts to learn\nits location have come to naught.
...But I succeed where they failed.\nI know where it is hidden.
I am a well-informed, intelligent man.\nIt was like stealing a lollipop from the\nmouth of a gurgling babe!
And you, old friend, are the first person\nto whom I have told this secret.
Just what are you planning here?

Despite my being a member of the
organization, I've no doubt they would
lock the relic away from all prying eyes—
which is why I must have it for my own.
Alas, it is hidden in a perilous location\nI cannot reach on my own—which is\nwhere you come into the picture.
I see. And what's in it for me?
The relic is yours. All I wish to do\nis study it and observe it in action.
Not sure if you've noticed, but we're\nnot exactly at war right now.\nWho would I even use it on?
But plenty of others ARE! North Grastaea,\nfor example, always seems to be involved\nin one conflict or another these days.
Such places will give you ample\nopportunity to fight and achieve glory\nby using the relic.
Gonna be honest: You ain't exactly\nsellin' me on this plan of yours.
(Hate to admit it, but his idea sounds a\nhell of a lot better than rottin' away here\nfor the rest of my days. Should I try it?)
Wait, aren't you one of our servants?\nWhat are you doing here?
Sir, the mistress of the house requests\nthat you return home early today if\npossible.
Apparently she has a very important\nmatter to discuss with you, sir.
Heh. So she's finally ready, eh?
HmmMMM. I suppose I'll need to convince\nyour wife to go along with my plan before\nyou will even consider it.

It's not like there's any love in our
marriage. It's just somethin' we were
forced into so I wouldn't challenge the
emperor again.
She's not been feelin' well lately,\nand I imagine our sham arrangement\nhas a lot to do with it.
Like as not, she wants to talk to me now\nabout callin' the whole damn thing off.\n...Ha! Bwaaaaa ha ha ha!

Dust off your boots, Sha Wujing—we're
blowin' this fried-meat stand. A wild
adventure somewhere far from here
sounds like JUST what I need.
And that's how I went along with his idea without\neven hearing what the wife had to say first.
I know it ain't possible to change the past...\nbut if I could, I'd go back and kick the crap\noutta myself for makin' that decision!
